titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Duke Amandla Chorus records, 2016-2017 UA.31.07.0015

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-06-08 11:22:08 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Duke Amandla Chorus is a student chorale organization that performs traditional music from various countries in Africa in the respective languages. The records span 2016-2017 and include images, moving image recordings, photographs, lyrics, and organizational records.
did.langmaterial: Materials in English and various African languages

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Duke Amandla Chorus is Duke University's first African chorus, and performs traditional music from various countries in Africa in the respective languages. The chorus shares stories about the culture and people and incorporates dancing and African instruments. "Amandla" is a Zulu and Xhosa word that means "power," and the Chorus uses music as an avenue to teach the Duke and Durham community about the multiplicity of African culture, history, and values.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Electronic records in this collection have been migrated to a library server and digital use copies can only be accessed onsite in the Rubenstein Library Reading Room.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Duke Amandla Chorus records were received by the Duke University Archives as a transfer in 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Duke Amandla Chorus Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: UA2017-0021

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Duke Amandla Chorus records span 2016-2017 and include images and moving image recordings of various performances, group photographs, lyrics, meeting minutes, a rehearsal schedule, and the Duke Amandla Chorus logo.

did.physdesc: 2 document files in Microsoft Word format.
Three digital photographs (JPEG format) and two moving images files (MPEG-4 format in MOV wrapper); approximately 0.43 gigabytes.

Three moving image files (MPEG-4 format in MOV wrapper); approximately 0.07 gigabytes.
